checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
Squidpy is a Python library built on scanpy that provides tools for analyzing spatial molecular data, including spatial transcriptomics, by enabling neighborhood analysis, cell-cell interaction detection, and spatial pattern recognition.

Squidpy is used for data preprocessing and spatial analysis in the proposal.

Aligns with the approved research topics Datascience and Engineering and Bioscience.

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
MONAI (Medical Open Network for AI) is an opensource PyTorch-based framework developed by NVIDIA for deep learning in healthcare imaging, providing domain-optimized tools for medical image analysis including preprocessing, training, and deployment.

 MONAI is used for H&E whole-slide image (WSI) processing in the proposal, specifically for:

WSI I/O (input/output) operations
Image tiling of histological whole-slide images
Data augmentations and transformations for H&E tissue images
Supporting the vision transformer that processes tiled H&E images

Aligns with approved research topics Health and wellness, Bioscience, and Datascience & engineering

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
The dataset contains quality-controlled single-cell and single-nucleus RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq/snRNA-seq) transcriptomic profiles of mouse brain cells with region and layer metadata, comprising approximately 7 million cells profiled (4 million passing QC) that identify over 5,300 distinct cell types across the entire adult mouse brain.

The dataset is used for: (a) training the RNA encoder (gene-token transformer) for single-cell transcriptomic data, (b) providing quality-controlled scRNA-seq with region/layer metadata for the Brain-3D-FM foundation model, (c) enabling RNA↔ST cross-modal contrastive alignment, and (d) supporting zero-shot cell-type annotation and 3D volumetric reconstruction objectives.

Aligns with approved research topic, Bioscience

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:
The dataset is owned and maintained by the NIH BRAIN Initiative Cell Census Network (BICCN), with the Brain Cell Data Center (BCDC) hosted at the Allen Institute for Brain Science (Seattle, WA).

The maintainer is an entity from non-D5 country.

checks.name: Prompts / Fine-tuning Scripts
checks.notes: No file provided.

checks.notes: Low risk, skipping sample inspection.

checks.name: Provenance
checks.notes:
https://biccn.org/

Creator: The BICCN was launched in 2017 by the NIH as part of the Brain Research Through Advancing Innovative Neurotechnologies (BRAIN) Initiative, with data generated by a collaborative network of ~20 U.S. and international institutions.

Current Maintainer: The Allen Institute for Brain Science operates the BCDC (biccn.org) and coordinates data integration, standards development, and public dissemination across four data archives (NeMO, BIL, DANDI, BossDB).

checks.name: License / Permissions
checks.notes:
Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0)

Permissions:

Free to download, analyze, and publish results immediately upon release
Free to share (copy and redistribute) in any medium or format
Free to adapt (remix, transform, and build upon) the material
Commercial and non-commercial use permitted

Requirements:

Must provide appropriate attribution/credit to BICCN and data-generating laboratories
Must provide a link to the license
Must indicate if changes were made to the original data
Citation of BICCN and contributing laboratories required in publications

Restrictions:

Human datasets not consented for open-access have individual restrictions in separate License Agreements
Some network members may claim patent/copyright on portions of submitted data (checked case-by-case)
No explicit use restrictions for mouse data (unrestricted access and use)

checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
The BICCN mouse brain spatial transcriptomics dataset contains MERFISH imaging of >1,100 genes in ~8-10 million cells across serial coronal and sagittal sections (10-μm thick, 100-200μm intervals) spanning whole adult mouse brains, with DAPI stains for cell segmentation registered to the Allen CCFv3 using Nissl template images paired histology is provided through adjacent histological sections aligned to Slide-seq arrays, which are rich in neuroanatomical detail rather than traditional H&E staining.

Based on the proposal, this dataset supports: (a) providing ST matrices with spatial coordinates for the spatial graph transformer encoder, (b) enabling RNA↔ST cross-modal contrastive alignment by integrating MERFISH and scRNA-seq data, (c) supporting zero-shot cell-type annotation and 3D volumetric reconstruction through CCF registration, and (d) contributing to the vision transformer input via co-registered histological images across serial sections for H&E-like morphological context.

Aligns with approved research topic Bioscience

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes: No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes:

checks.name: Provenance
checks.notes:
https://biccn.org/

Created: 2017 by NIH BRAIN Initiative through the BRAIN Initiative Cell Census Network (BICCN), a 5-year phase with the goal of systematic multimodal cell type profiling and characterization of the whole mouse brain.

Generated by: Collaborative network including Allen Institute for Brain Science, Harvard University (Zhuang Lab), Broad Institute (Macosko/Chen Labs), and ~20 U.S./international institutions

Current Steward: Allen Institute for Brain Science operates the Brain Cell Data Center (BCDC) and the Allen Brain Cell Atlas platform, coordinating data integration, standards development, and public dissemination across four archives: NeMO, BIL, DANDI, and BossDB

form_data.observations:
Brain-3D-FM has been expressed as the target model to train, no source has been provided.

No source has been provided; therefore model's analysis was not possible.
form_data.recommendation:
Need to contact the applicants to get access to the model. 
Conditional on no flags in model evaluation, the project is recommended for the grand challenge.
